channel.title: CNN.com - Entertainment
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - Entertainment
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Buddy Holly plane crash may be re-examined
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board may be taking another look at the 1959 plane crash that killed Buddy Holly, Ritchie Valens and J.P. "The Big Bopper" Richardson.

item.title: Is Maggie Smith leaving 'Downton Abbey'?

Today is Bobbi Kristina Brown's birthday

'Orange Is the New Black' to return
Judge Judy extended through 2020
'Sharknado 3' starring Ann Coulter, Jerry Springer
'Walking Dead' town for sale
Did 'SNL' ISIS skit cross a line?
item.description: Skewering ISIS with comedy undermines the terror group ... and beats cowering in fear, Dean Obeidallah says.

item.title: 'Good Wife' follows GOP's Twitter play
item.description: Alicia Florrick's fictional campaign is stealing a line from Republicans' real-world playbook.

item.title: Who are these 'Power/Rangers' guys?
Shatner defends missing Nimoy's funeral
'Fault in Our Stars' team reunites for new adaptation
item.description: Screenwriters who brought "Fault in Our Stars" to the big screen will reunite for next John Green adaptation, "Looking for Alaska."

item.title: Shatner: Nimoy made Spock his own
item.description: In an interview taped two days before Leonard Nimoy's death, William Shatner reflects on Nimoy's legacy.

item.title: 'Modern Family' episode shot with Apple devices
item.description: A recent "Modern Family" epsiode, titled "Connection Lost," was shot entirely using Apple products and revolved around the family communicating via iPhones, iPads and a MacBook.

item.title: Why Taylor Swift took viral bikini photo
item.description: Taylor Swift says she posted a photo in her bikini because she didn't want the paparazzi to make money off of their shot.

item.title: Kimmel rips anti-vaxxers in mock PSA
item.description: Jimmy Kimmel took on the controversial topic of vaccination with a mock PSA from actual doctors.

item.title: Pitbull's cross-cultural appeal
item.description: Rapper Pitbull talks to CNN's Nischelle Turner about his rise as an artist from Miami's streets to an international star.

item.title: John Travolta doubles down on awkward Oscars moment
item.description: Idina Menzel takes it on the chin from John Travolta. Jeanne Moos reports Travolta is being mocked by comparisons to Mr. Spock.

item.title: Why do we fat-shame actresses?
item.description: In this week's Lisa's Desk episode, Lisa talks about a recent incident involving "Trainwreck" actress Amy Schumer, who is a size 6.

item.title: Take a selfie with your favorite Star Wars characters
item.description: Starting in May, Star Wars fans in London will be able to meet their favorite characters at a special exhibition at Madame Tussauds.

item.title: 'American Horror Story' actor dies
'Paradise Lost' trilogy director dies
item.description: Oscar-nominated filmmaker Bruce Sinofsky, whose series on the "West Memphis Three" cast doubt on the murder convictions of three Arkansas teenagers, catalyzing a movement that led to their release, died Saturday, longtime collaborator Joe Berlinger said.

item.title: 'Real Chance Of Love' star Ahmad 'Real' Givens dies
item.description: Ahmad "Real" Givens, who appeared on VH1 dating show "Real Chance of Love," has died after battling colon cancer, the network said Saturday.

Former Beatle and Clapton wife looks back with love
item.description: The rock stars of the '60s and '70s have, inevitably, gotten older. Many are now in their 70s; some have even passed on. Pattie Boyd still sees them as vigorous youths.

item.title: Who won Independent Spirit Awards?
'We Are the World' turns 30
'Fresh Off The Boat' sitcom draws backlash after tweet
item.description: ABC's "Fresh Off The Boat," the first sitcom to feature an Asian American family in two decades, has run into renewed controversy a week before its debut.
